intro: Anagallis angustiloba, commonly known as narrowleaf mouse-ear, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a low-growing annual or biennial species characterized by its small, hairy leaves and clusters of delicate, pink to red flowers. The plant typically thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is known for its rapid growth and short life cycle. Anagallis angustiloba is sometimes cultivated as a ornamental plant due to its attractive, showy blooms.
